title: How to Make a Dark and Milk Chocolate Fridge Cake

steps.headline: Add water to a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Place a bowl on top of the saucepan.
steps.description: Place the milk chocolate, dark chocolate, and butter in the bowl and stir until ingredients have melted. Remove bowl from heat.

steps.headline: Crush the biscuits into little crumbs.
Add cocoa powder to the chocolate / butter mixture and stir.
steps.description: For a sweeter cake, you can add a bit of white sugar.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into a baking tin.
Sprinkle sultanas on top of the cake (if you have chosen to use them), then put the cake into the fridge.
Leave the cake in the fridge for at least 2-3 hours, then serve.

text: Add water to a saucepan and bring to a boil.  Place a bowl on top of the saucepan. Place the milk chocolate, dark chocolate, and butter in the bowl and stir until ingredients have melted. Remove bowl from heat. Crush the biscuits into little crumbs.  Add cocoa powder to the chocolate / butter mixture and stir. For a sweeter cake, you can add a bit of white sugar. Mix in the crumbed biscuits.  Pour the mixture into a baking tin.  Sprinkle sultanas on top of the cake (if you have chosen to use them), then put the cake into the fridge.  Leave the cake in the fridge for at least 2-3 hours, then serve.
